verbose_text: Reverse transcription-quantitative PCR, western blot and immunohistochemistry analyses confirmed that silencing the CDC25A gene downregulated the expression of IL-6 in HepG2 cells and the mRNA and protein expression of IL-1beta, mitogen activated protein kinase kinase kinase 14 (NIK) and nuclear factor-kappaB (NF-kappaB), which are regulatory molecules upstream of IL-6.
